topic.title: HTTPS to private zeronet proxy?
topic.body: I have a certificate for my personal domain, is there a way to get zeronet to use it to serve the proxy over https?

topic.title: Is it possible to use zeroframe to create a subdirectory of /data/{user}/dir?
[PSA] KopyKate Big Official 0/0 peers on upload.
topic.body:
I've noticed that when I put an upload on KopyKate that I won't even be able to access my own content.
Thankfully there is a solution I've found that works.

You're going to need the following things:
•The big.kopykate.bit's current address (18Pfr2oswXvD352BbJvo59gZ3GbdbipSzh at time of writing)
•The user folder under the certificate you uploaded the video with
•The filename of the video that KopyKate has saved

Go to the page of the video that you posted (I did this by going to "airing now") and then right-click "copy video location".
That will give you your user folder and the filename of the video.

Then you simply copy the video to: 
{ZeroNetHome}/data/{KopyKate's Address}/users/{your user folder}/{video filename}.mp4/webm/whatever

This is where it gets fuzzy, but I'm very sure you only need to refresh the page to fix it, however I believe commenting allows is to properly show 1/1 peers when you're viewing your own fresh video.

I just figured I would write this up in case anyone was having any trouble putting their videos on KopyKate because I see many videos with 0/0 peers.

topic.title: ZeroHello questions
topic.body:
I've noticed that setting ZeroHello theme to "Dark/Light" changes ZeroTalk and others.
Is there a way to have my sites inherit the same style?

How does a site publish to ZeroHello? ie What do you need to recreate the "Follow" button.

topic.title: Help with bigfile upload support
ZeroNet + IPFS companion = Neat stuff
topic.body:
Apparently IPFS has a browser add-on that will load content from ipfs://s0m3hash
Tried it out with a simple image [here]( http://127.0.0.1:43110/1HvbktyUgL8gyV7xRTuY8uUku72Y9dZXxC/)
The browser add-on supports ipfs commands as well by inserting a window.ipfs interface:
https://github.com/ipfs-shipyard/ipfs-companion/blob/master/docs/window.ipfs.md#notes-on-exposing-ipfs-api-as-windowipfs

1551207819_12VymSc4V2txj33jEst53biLBrFqr.body:
Alright so I gave this a stab.
I was able to install the app from https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=net.mkg20001.zeronet and get the app on the SD card. However it keeps putting zeronet data in internal storage/android rather than external storage/android.
I have a pretty large sd card so it would be much more useful if I could configure mobile zeronet to work with the SD card.



User experience otherwise is pretty good, once things are mostly downloaded it works very well. I was impressed that you could update zeronet once installed.

1553015350_12ETjYdAqyFq3T1LxfE4NwKwWkB1D.body:
Lots of people tearing down his implementation in the comments. More power to him though!
Nice to see someone attempting what I've seen many say can't be done. This is definitely a good learning experience for everyone involved.

1553043349_1PZnbAYUg4AzDgJU4gtTupekoaNp1.body:
> [60](#comment_24_1Ekf2tGQLhG3iifFsuUk9RcBPx26cQmCD1): use nginx [...]
Worked for me! Thank you

1553710396_1BMRs7eu9rH13ZmjhkXfdQpfNtury.body:
On my ZeroHello > Stats
"Connections:45 of 2452 peers"
I assume these are instances seeding all sites, would likely be a useful metric for overall growth over time.

1554003128_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRF.body:
I've had trouble keeping the site files on the SD.
In another ZeroTalk thread someone pointed out that this is a great way to wear out your sdcard, so it might not be worth using it as your primary instance if your phone storage is limited.

1554110095_18n7wVi3xtKGEp4a4BYPuhEdfMszt.body:
I hope none of the site owners implement any.
If you're concerned about your box, you could limit optional files and be careful of which sites you visit.

1554068932_17bfQv5PQW9FZ4akChr7ECfqP2SKu.body:
In theory they could just set up custom url filters on 127.0.0.1 to match, but that wouldn't work with public/private proxies.

But there isn't anything preventing anyone from creating a site here that records comments for URLs all ober the clearnet/zeronet.

1554477808_17AMQVbBa12XB3xFWKDnP2dCEx92T.body:
That argument never really had legs, but even if it ever did, the culture war is in full swing. 
Regardless of your "side" in politics/identity/religion there are bad people with different views (and often the similar views) as you that absolutely will use whatever they can to take down "the enemy".

Traditionally people thing of privacy as from the government, but when radicals will take it on themselves to wage their own civil war, you're going to be a lot more careful about what can be used to find you.

Privacy and Freedom don't need a justification because they are ends to themselves.

1556161291_1DN24iDBCa558BcYjSz17fdXpFnJ6.body:
Fancy!
It's taking a while to setup my ID, but looking forward to it!
Edit: Seems it won't work at all, I downloaded the peermessage -py3- plugin, the warning on the page dissapears but will hang on the button-loading-circle thing for as long as I let it.
Edit2: Fixed! If you're getting error: Uncaught (in promise) Unknown command: peerBroadcast
My problem was that I had it /peermessage/peermessage3/{add-on files} rather than peermessage3/{add-on files}
